On Mar 28, 2007, at 8:55 AM, Jason Gauci wrote:

> I think the reason why my implementation is so fast is because of
> memory management.

Do you also order the nodes so that they need only be updated one  
time?  This is a common problem I've seen in several NEAT  
implementations.

Floats would certainly speed things up over doubles.

When you release it, I'll take a stab at it myself too.

--Steve
--Apple-Mail-6--776973272
